Description: Straight-sided cup with simple direct rim, 7.9cm in diameter, and angular carination to a recessed spot base. Covered with a cream slip on exterior and interior; decorated with a frieze indicated by two black painted lines below rim and three above base angle; within, red and black trefoil flowers. Pot incomplete. Fabric pink and tightly packed, some white, black and transluscent stones with flakes of red, likely Aswan ware imported from Egypt. Adams Type A17 (1986, fig. 19).
